intro: Torrubia longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf torrubia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in late spring. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, providing a dense canopy that supports various wildlife. Torrubia longifolia is often found in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
